ccre.ctrl

Class PIDControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.PIDControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventOutput, FloatInput, FloatInputPoll

    public class PIDControl
extends java.lang.Object
implements FloatInput, EventOutput
    A generic PID Controller for use in CCRE applications. Supports online tuning of various parameters. This will attempt to move the input close to the setpoint by way of varying the output according to the P, I, and D terms. It also supports limiting of the output range and the current integral sum. This is an EventOutput - when this is fired, it will update the current value. This is also a FloatInput, representing the current output from the PID controller.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDControl

        public PIDControl(FloatInputPoll error,
          FloatInputPoll P,
          FloatInputPoll I,
          FloatInputPoll D)
        Create a new PIDControl with the specified sources for its tuning, and no setpoint. This is equivalent to using the error parameter as the input parameter and a fixed setpoint of zero.
        Parameters:
        error - the error source for the PID controller.
        P - a source for the proportional term.
        I - a source for the integral term.
        D - a source for the derivative term.

      • PIDControl

        public PIDControl(FloatInputPoll input,
          FloatInputPoll setpoint,
          FloatInputPoll P,
          FloatInputPoll I,
          FloatInputPoll D)
        Create a new PIDControl with the specified sources for its tuning.
        Parameters:
        input - the input source for the PID controller.
        setpoint - the setpoint source for the PID controller.
        P - a source for the proportional term.
        I - a source for the integral term.
        D - a source for the derivative term.

    • Method Detail

      • createFixedPID

        public static PIDControl createFixedPID(EventInput trigger,
                        FloatInputPoll input,
                        FloatInputPoll setpoint,
                        float p,
                        float i,
                        float d)
        Create a simple fixed PID controller. It's very much possible to have more control - just instantiate the class directly.
        Parameters:
        trigger - when to update.
        input - the input to track.
        setpoint - the setpoint to attempt to move the input to.
        p - the proportional constant.
        i - the integral constant.
        d - the derivative constant.
        Returns:
        the PID controller, which is also an input representing the current value.

      • setMaximumTimeDelta

        public void setMaximumTimeDelta(float delta)
        Set the maximum time delta: if two execution of the PIDControl differ by more than the maximum time delta, the controller will pretend it only differed by the maximum time delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - the new maximum time delta.

        Specified by:

      • send

        public void send(FloatOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInput
        Subscribe to changes in this float input's value. The float output will be modified whenever the value of this input changes. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f. If available, the current value of the input will be written at this time.
        Specified by:
        send in interface FloatInput
        Parameters:
        output - The float output to notify when the value changes.
        See Also:
        FloatOutput.set(float), FloatInput.unsend(ccre.channel.FloatOutput)

      • unsend

        public void unsend(FloatOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInput
        Unsubscribe from changes in this float input's value. This reverses the actions of a previous send call. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        unsend in interface FloatInput
        Parameters:
        output - The output to unsubscribe.
        See Also:
        FloatInput.send(ccre.channel.FloatOutput)

      • get

        public float get()
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputPoll
        Get the current state of this float input. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        get in interface FloatInputPoll
        Returns:
        The current value.
